name: Picture File
summary: Learn about .PICT files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: In 1984, Apple created the PICT image format. This vector image format is native to Macintosh computers and was used by Mac OS's QuickDraw graphics library and API.
The first version of the PICT format, known as PICT 1, supports up to eight colors. The second version, known as PICT 2, supports 24- and 32-bit color, allowing images to include millions of colors.
Both versions of the PICT format have since been deprecated and largely replaced by the .PDF format. PICT files may also be saved with the .PCT extension.

description: A PICT file is a a graphics image saved in the Apple Macintosh picture file format. It can store image data as both raster and vector file formats. It was default picture file format for Apple QuickDraw programme. PICT files allow the exchange of raster as well as vector data between Mac applications. The format has long been replaced by the more flexible PDF file format. PICT files are sometimes found with .PCT extension.

A PICT file is an image saved in the Macintosh PICT format, which was used by the QuickDraw graphics library. PICT files are vector graphics that may contain embedded raster graphics. The PICT format has been deprecated, so PICT files are uncommon.
